title: Carol Vorderman, 56, leads stars at Cheltenham Festival
title_page: Carol Vorderman, 56, leads stars at Cheltenham Festival  | Daily Mail Online
text:
She touched down in Cheltenham in style, co-piloting a helicopter into the racing grounds.
And Carol Vorderman's attire matched her glamorous arrival as she dressed in an elegant black dress and feathered hat to lead a starry turnout.
Aside from her age-defying figure, the 56-year-old didn't miss the opportunity to draw attention to her two-awarded rear of the year in a figure hugging dress.
Scroll down for video
Top bird: Caroline Vorderman certainly lead the glamour at The Cheltenham Festival on Thursday in a fitting black dress
Here they come: taking to Instagram, the TV presenter shared a snap of herself and a group of friends arriving at the event via helicopter
Carol offset a statement mididress with a contrasting brown belt and sexy black leather gloves, posing with a hand on her hip to accentuate her pert behind.
Having previously been praised with the ''Rear Of The Year' - best bottom in Britain - accolade in 2014 and 2016, Carol this year attracted another title for her youthful body.
In January, the nation recently made the I'm a Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here contestant the UK's favourite Fifty Plus Beach Body.
Gorgeous: The TV personality rocked a glamorous top-to-toe black look, complete with a hat
Hers was chosen as the celebrity beach body they most admired behind the likes of Halle Berry, who came second, and Helen Mirren and Goldie Hawn.
Her extravagant fascinator set off the image, and added something of a countryside vibe to her sassy outfit yet there was a further story behind the decision to wear the hair piece, as she explained online.
'[I] am guest of the incredible genius and racing legend Michael Dickinson today,' Carol excitedly told her Twitter followers as she arrived on the grounds for Day Three.
Ready to ride: Carol tweeted about arriving in style to the Cheltenham Festival on Thursday
Tricky: She saw the humorous side when her headset had to be worn upside down to avoid ruining her hair
She'd been up late sharing her excitement about arriving at Cheltenham in a helicopter.
But Carol, who obtained her pilot's liscence almost three years ago, made it clear that her outfit was far too precious for her to be at the helm of the aircraft, this time.
'Cheltenham tomorrow,' she wrote. 'Flying in a helicopter (I'm not pilot...Won't get headset over hat!)'
Low and behold, the TV personality shared the humorous side of the flight in pictures the next morning, as she attended to wear the headset upside down, to avoid spoiling her perfectly coiffed hair.
Carol had squeezed all of her girlfriends into the back of the aircraft to make it a full day out.
Wearing a cap: Carol covered up in a flat cap and a coat, later that afternoon
Taking pictures: The stunner found the whole look very amusing
Joker: Carol laughed as she took multiple pictures of herself
Giddy: Carol made it clear that it was her outfit that was standing in her way of piloting the helicopter
Special guest: Carol explained that she was a guest of Michael Dickinson
Also in attendance: Coronation Street's Michael Le Vell was one of the guests
